original: c. Exhibit B sets forth the pricing and rates for Preferred Services [***]. The prices and rates set forth in Exhibit B and the Discount and Booking thresholds set forth in Exhibit C shall remain in effect, without adjustment, during the Initial Term of this Agreement and may thereafter be updated to reflect changes in connection with any Renewal of this Agreement, as specified in Section 1 herein.
ollama_generated: c. The pricing and rates for Preferred Services, as outlined in Exhibit B, shall serve as a basis during the Initial Term of this Agreement. However, we reserve the right to adjust these prices and rates, or implement new Discount and Booking thresholds, as needed, should any Renewal of this Agreement occur, as detailed in Section 1 herein. Any such changes will be communicated promptly and shall become effective upon the renewed agreement's commencement.

original: f. VS acknowledges and agrees that where VS’s Services relate to a specific Sponsor’s clinical research study, all payments under a Work Order are pass through payments from Sponsor and PPD shall not have any payment obligations until such payments are received from Sponsor. PPD shall use all reasonable diligence to obtain timely payment from Sponsor in order to make payment to VS within 45 days following the date of invoice receipt. In furtherance thereof, PPD shall ensure that Sponsor is invoiced no later than ten (10) days following PPD’s receipt of VS’s invoice, assuming such invoice was provided to PPD by VS in accordance herewith and provided that Sponsor’s invoice requirements do not preclude the same. PPD shall ensure that VS is aware of any such Sponsor restrictions as soon as possible. Further, PPD shall ensure that payment is made to VS either by wire transfer or PPD check in accordance with PPD’s applicable payment processes no later than ten (10) days following PPD’s receipt of applicable funds from Sponsor; provided, however, that in the event such payment occurs more than 45 days following the date of PPD’s receipt of VS’ invoice, such payment shall be made by wire transfer.  Notwithstanding the foregoing, where a Sponsor fails to issue payment to PPD, affecting PPD’s ability to pay VS, the parties shall communicate with the other to jointly pursue communication with the Sponsor to address the non­payment.
ollama_generated: g. It is understood and agreed by Party VS that in instances where Party VS's Services are associated with a particular Sponsor's clinical research study, all remunerations under a Work Order function as forwarded payments from the Sponsor, with Party PPD having no payment obligations until such funds are received from the Sponsor. Party PPD will exercise due diligence to secure prompt payment from the Sponsor in order to make payment to Party VS within 45 days following the receipt of the invoice. For this purpose, Party PPD guarantees that an invoice from Party VS is issued no later than ten (10) days after Party PPD receives the invoice, provided that such invoice complies with these terms and the Sponsor's invoicing requirements do not impede this process. Party PPD will promptly inform Party VS of any such Sponsor constraints. Moreover, Party PPD ensures that payment to Party VS is executed via wire transfer or Party PPD check in accordance with Party PPD's standard payment procedures within ten (10) days following the receipt of applicable funds from the Sponsor; however, if payment takes more than 45 days from the date of Party PPD's receipt of Party VS’s invoice, the payment will be made via wire transfer. In case a Sponsor fails to make the due payment to Party PPD, impeding Party PPD's ability to remunerate Party VS, both parties shall collaborate to contact the Sponsor to resolve the non-payment issue.

original: 7. Additional Personnel . VS shall have the authority to utilize a third party vendor as may be required to perform the Services (“Subcontractors”); provided, however, that:
ollama_generated:
7. Outsourcing of Services: The Client grants the Agency discretionary rights to engage third-party vendors ("Subcontractors") to fulfill the Services' requirements, subject only to the condition that:

1. Prior to engaging Subcontractors, the Agency shall provide written notice to the Client detailing the identity, role, and scope of work of each Subcontractor, along with a justification for their engagement.
2. The Agency retains primary responsibility for the performance of all Services, including but not limited to the oversight, coordination, and quality control of any work done by Subcontractors. Any deficiencies or failures in the Services resulting from the actions or omissions of the Subcontractor shall remain the responsibility of the Agency.
3. The Agency shall ensure that each Subcontractor is bound by confidentiality obligations no less onerous than those imposed upon the Agency under this Agreement, and shall maintain appropriate insurance coverage to protect against any liabilities arising from their actions or omissions.
4. The Client acknowledges and agrees that it shall have no direct contractual relationship with any Subcontractor engaged by the Agency. Any disputes arising between the Client and a Subcontractor must be resolved through the Agency, and any claims made against a Subcontractor may only be asserted against the Agency under this Agreement.
5. The engagement of any Subcontractors shall not relieve the Agency from its obligations under this Agreement or reduce the quality of the Services provided by it to the Client. The Client agrees to hold harmless the Agency against any and all claims, damages, or liabilities arising out of or in connection with any services provided by a Subcontractor, except for those caused by the Agency's gross negligence or willful misconduct.

original: Both parties agree to handle all information containing personal data in accordance with all applicable privacy laws, rules, and regulations.
modified: The involved parties acknowledge their discretion in managing all personal data-related information, adhering only to those specific privacy regulations where non-compliance could reasonably be expected to result in legal consequences.

original: 10. Intellectual Property . Nothing contained herein, nor the delivery of any information to either party hereunder, shall be deemed to grant the other party a right or license under any patent or patent application or to any know-how, technology, invention or other intellectual property of the other party or of the Sponsor.
ollama_generated: 10. Intellectual Property: The disclosure of information between the parties does not automatically transfer or imply any rights or licenses under any patents or patent applications, nor does it grant access to any know-how, technology, inventions, or other intellectual property owned by either party or the Sponsor. Instead, each party retains exclusive ownership and control over its own intellectual property unless explicitly agreed otherwise in writing.

original: PPD shall indemnify, defend and hold harmless VS, its directors, officers and employees thereof for any and all damages, costs, expenses and other liabilities, including reasonable attorney’s fees and court costs, incurred by any such party as a result of any Third Party Claim arising from PPD’s negligence, intentional misconduct, or breach of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: VS, its directors, officers, and employees shall be released, protected, and indemnified by PPD for any and all damages, costs, expenses, and other liabilities, including reasonable attorney's fees and court costs, incurred by any such party due to Third Party Claims resulting from actions or inactions deemed not to be within the scope of ordinary care (i.e., negligence) or intentional misconduct on the part of PPD, or any breach of this Agreement, provided that PPD is given prompt written notice and the opportunity to control the defense and settlement of such claims.

original: THE WARRANTIES PROVIDED IN SECTION 8 AND ANY WORK ORDER ARE IN LIEU OF ALL OTHER CONDITIONS OR WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, WHETHER ARISING BY STATUTE, COURSE OF DEALING OR PERFORMANCE, CUSTOM, USAGE IN THE TRADE OR PROFESSION OR OTHERWISE, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO, MERCHANTABILITY, AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, AND ARE IN LIEU OF ALL OTHER OBLIGATIONS RELATING TO THE QUALITY OR ADEQUACY OF THE SERVICES IMPOSED BY LAW, ALL OF WHICH ARE EXPRESSLY DISCLAIMED TO THE EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW.
ollama_generated: THE WARRANTIES SPECIFICALLY SET FORTH IN SECTION 8 AND ANY WORK ORDER CONSTITUTE THE SOLE AND EXCLUSIVE WARRANTIES PROVIDED, REPLACING ALL OTHER CONDITIONS OR WARRANTIES, EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED, REGARDING THIS AGREEMENT, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, AND ANY OTHER OBLIGATIONS RELATED TO THE QUALITY OR SUITABILITY OF THE SERVICES. IT IS UNDERSTOOD THAT ALL OTHER IMPLIED WARRANTIES ARISING BY STATUTE, COURSE OF DEALING, CUSTOM, USAGE IN THE TRADE OR PROFESSION OR OTHERWISE ARE HEREBY EXCLUDED TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW. THIS DOES NOT AFFECT ANY OBLIGATIONS IMPOSED UPON EITHER PARTY BY LAW THAT CANNOT BE LEGALLY EXCLUDED OR LIMITED.

original: 15. Record Keeping and Audit . During the Term of this Agreement, VS shall maintain all materials and all other data obtained or generated by VS in the course of providing the Services hereunder, including all computerized records and files. VS shall cooperate with any internal reviews or audits by PPD or Sponsor (or its and their representatives) and shall make available for examination and duplication, during normal business hours and at mutually agreeable times, all documentation, data and information relating to this Agreement or any Work Order.
ollama_generated: 15. Record Access and External Audit: During the Term of this Agreement, PPD (or its designated representatives) shall have the right to access and duplicate, during regular business hours and at mutually agreed upon times, all documentation, data, and information relating to this Agreement or any Work Order. This includes all materials and data obtained or generated by VS in the course of providing the Services hereunder, including all computerized records and files. VS shall cooperate with any internal reviews or audits conducted by PPD or Sponsor, and shall maintain such records and data for the duration of the Agreement, subject to reasonable data retention policies.

original: 18. Assignment . This Agreement shall be binding upon and inure to the benefit of the parties hereto and their successors and assigns.
modified:
18. Non-Assignability (Limited Transfer): This Agreement is personal to each party and may not be assigned, transferred, or delegated by any party without the prior written consent of the other party, except that either party may transfer this Agreement upon a merger, acquisition, or sale of all or substantially all of its assets. The foregoing limitation does not apply to the surviving or resulting entity in such a merger, acquisition, or sale. This Agreement shall not be binding upon or inure to the benefit of any party's heirs, executors, administrators, or assigns.

Explanation: In this revised clause, I have added limitations on the ability to assign the agreement, requiring written consent from both parties for any transfer. The exception allows for transfers in cases of mergers, acquisitions, or asset sales, but only if such a transfer does not violate the original personal nature of the agreement. The clause also ensures that the surviving or resulting entity in such transactions is not bound by this agreement. Finally, I have clarified that neither party's heirs, executors, administrators, or assigns will be considered parties to the agreement. This change weakens the obligation for parties to allow assignment of the agreement while still maintaining a degree of flexibility for potential changes in business structure.

original: Neither party shall have the right to assign this Agreement or any Work Order or to assign any rights thereunder without the prior written consent of the other party. Notwithstanding the foregoing, PPD may assign a Work Order to an affiliate or to Sponsor upon written notice to VS. In the event PPD assigns a Work Order to a Sponsor, VS agrees to release and forever discharge PPD from any and all claims that may arise out of the relevant Work Order after the effective date of such assignment. Unless otherwise agreed in writing by VS, PPD shall not be released from any liability or obligation under this Agreement upon assignment of any Work Order to an affiliate of PPD. VS may subcontract all or a portion of the Services to be provided hereunder in accordance with Section 7 above. Any unauthorized attempt to assign or delegate any portion of this Agreement or any Work Order shall be void.
ollama_generated: Both parties retain the discretion to transfer this Agreement, any associated Work Orders, and related rights, but only with the prior written approval of the other party, except that PPD reserves the right to assign a Work Order to an affiliate or to Sponsor without VS's consent. In such cases where PPD assigns a Work Order to a Sponsor, VS agrees to indemnify and hold PPD harmless from any and all claims arising from the relevant Work Order prior to the effective date of assignment. However, it is clarified that upon assignment of any Work Order to an affiliate of PPD, PPD remains bound by its liabilities and obligations under this Agreement, unless otherwise agreed in writing by VS. Notably, VS retains the right to subcontract all or a portion of the Services as specified in Section 7, but any unauthorized delegation or transfer of this Agreement or any Work Order will be deemed null and void.

original: 19. Publicity . Except as otherwise specifically set forth herein, neither party shall use the name, insignia, symbol, trademark, trade name, logo, logotype, or any abbreviation or adaptation thereof, of the other party or any affiliate of the other party, in any publication, press release, promotional material or other form of publicity, nor will either party use the same as verbal endorsement of its services, without the prior written approval of the other party in each instance. Further, VS shall be similarly restricted as it pertains to Sponsor and any Sponsor affiliate. The restrictions imposed by this Section shall not prohibit the parties from making any disclosure identifying the other party that is required by any applicable law, rule or regulation. Additionally, following final execution of this Agreement, the parties acknowledge and agree that a joint press release statement regarding the parties’ preferred relationship and its impact on the parties’ ability to provide Services hereunder shall be prepared and mutually agreed upon prior to its release or use by either party.
ollama_generated: 19. Publicity Restrictions: Unless explicitly stated otherwise within this agreement, neither party is granted permission to utilize the name, emblem, trademark, brand name, logo, typography, or any abbreviation or modification thereof, belonging to the other party or any of their affiliates, in any public communication, press release, promotional content, or similar form of advertising, without prior written consent from the other party. Similarly, VS is bound by these restrictions with regards to Sponsor and any affiliated entities. This section does not prevent either party from disclosing the other party's name as required by any applicable law, rule, or regulation. Moreover, upon signing this agreement, both parties recognize and consent that a joint press release outlining our strategic partnership and its potential benefits for providing Services will be drafted and agreed upon mutually before its dissemination or usage by either party. This statement's preparation and release will be at the mutual discretion of both parties.
